newsitem.title: USA: Creative Technology CEO increases stake by two pct.
newsitem.headline: Creative Technology CEO increases stake by two pct.

text.p: Creative Technology Ltd's Chief Executive Sim Wong Hoo said Wednesday he bought 1.7 million shares of his own company in the past two weeks, signaling better times for the maker of personal computer sound cards.
Sim, who is also chairman of Singapore-based Creative, increased his stake to about 29 percent after the purchase.
For the past few quarters, Creative has been cutting jobs and trimming operations because of declining sales, increasing competition from other PC component makers and dropping prices.
Creative makes the Sound Blaster cards - electronic devices for PCs that improve the machine's audio capabilities. The company gets about 75 percent of its revenue from sound cards.
In the most recent quarter, Creative reported that its net income more than doubled to $56.9 million, or $0.64 a share, because of massive cost reductions.

Sim said his company's restructuring is complete. While revenue for the fiscal year ending June 31 will decline from the year before, Sim said he expects "modest" revenue growth for the fiscal year ending June 1998.
The company will continue to concentrate on making PC sound cards and audio products, Sim said.
"There's nothing wrong with being a one-product company," he said "Intel is a one-product company." ((--Kourosh Karimkhany in San Francisco, 415 846 5401))
